item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign shipments and digital sales top five million; Elden Ring expansion ‘Shadow of the Erdtree’ tops 10 million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

New sales milestone achieved.

Total worldwide shipments and digital sales for Elden Ring Nightreign have surpassed five million units, and Elden Ring expansion “Shadow of the Erdtree” has surpassed 10 million units, publisher Bandai Namco and developer FromSoftware announced.

Elden Ring Nightreign launched for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam today on May 30, and surpassed two million shipments and digital sales in one day. It was last reported to have surpassed 3.5 million units on June 3.

Elden Ring expansion “Shadow of the Erdtree” launched on February 25, 2022, and was last reported to have shipped five million units within its first three days of release. Elden Ring, which is required to play the expansion, is available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam. A Switch 2 version is due out in 2025.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/elden-ring-nightreign-shipments-and-digital-sales-top-five-million-elden-ring-expansion-shadow-of-the-erdtree-tops-10-million

item.title: Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket ‘Wisdom of Sea and Sky’ expansion launches July 30
item.content:encoded:
• Smartphone

The mighty Lugia and Ho-Oh make their debut.

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket expansion “Wisdom of Sea and Sky” will launch on July 29 at 11:00 p.m. PT / July 30 at 2:00 a.m. ET, The Pokemon Company announced.

The description reads: “In Wisdom of Sea and Sky, players can encounter Pokemon from the beloved Johto region, first discovered in the Pokemon Gold and Pokemon Silver video games, including Chikorita, Cyndaquil, Totodile, and the Legendary duo Lugia and Ho-Oh. In this expansion, Pokemon with attacks that don’t require Energy will also debut, unlocking new strategies for battling and deck building.”

The July 30 update will also introduce a new wishlist system and updates to the game’s trade feature. Players will be able to:

  • Add up to 20 cards to a wishlist and highlight three favorites on their profile.
  • Trade without tokens (which are being retired), and instead use shinedust, which can be acquired via missions, achievements, or by obtaining duplicates of already owned cards

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket is available now for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play.

Watch a trailer for the expansion below.

Expansion “Wisdom of Sea and Sky” Announce Trailer

English

Japanese



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/pokemon-trading-card-game-pocket-wisdom-of-sea-and-sky-expansion-launches-july-30

item.title: Dorfromantik for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, and Xbox One launches August 14
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Peaceful building strategy and puzzle game dated.

The PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One versions of strategy / puzzle game Dorfromantik will launch on August 14, publisher Headup and developer Toukana Interactive announced.

Dorfromantik first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam and GOG on March 25, 2021, followed by a full launch on April 28, 2022. A Switch version was released on September 29, 2022. iOS and Android versions, reimagined by Clockstone Studio, are also planned for release.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Dorfromantik is a relaxing building strategy and puzzle game in which you place tiles to create ever-growing, idyllic village landscapes. With Dorfromantik, you can immerse yourself in a quiet, peaceful world at any time and take a break from everyday life. At the same time, Dorfromantik offers a challenge for those who are looking for one: To beat the high score, you need to carefully plan and strategically place your tiles.

Gameplay

In Dorfromantik you start with a stack of procedurally generated tiles. One after the other, you draw the top tile of the stack, place it on one available slot and rotate for the best fit. Thereby groups and combinations of landscapes are formed, such as forests, villages or water bodies, and you are rewarded with points depending on how well the tile fits.

On some tiles you will also encounter special objects that give you a quest: For example, the windmill wants to border 6 grain fields, the locomotive wants to be connected to 10 tracks or the deer wants to inhabit a forest with at least 50 trees. Fulfill these quests to get more tiles to continue the expansion of your landscape. The game ends when the tile stack is used up.

As you expand the landscape, you can advance into new, colorful biomes and discover pre-placed game objects that give you long-term tasks. Through these tasks you can unlock new tiles, new biomes and new quests.

Key Features

  • Building endless and beautiful landscapes.
  • Unique mix of strategy and puzzle mechanics.
  • Relaxing and calming gameplay.
  • Idyllic village scenery.
  • Strategic placement to beat the high score.
  • High replay value—every session is different.
  • Many unlockable tiles and biomes.
  • Original art style with hand-painted board game feel.

Not Features

  • 4X strategy.
  • Trading.
  • Resource management.
  • Combat and violence.
  • Multiplayer.

Game Modes

Dorfromantik offers options for any style of play! Take a short break from life in quick mode or try to master the game in hard mode. The Custom Mode allows you to create your own rulesets and share them with others, while monthly mode awaits you with a new challenge every month. If you just want to relax and build your own landscape with no limits, try the creative mode!



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/07/dorfromantik-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-and-xbox-one-launches-august-14

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 7/14/25 – 7/20/25
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Donkey Kong Bananza opens at 127,905 retail sales.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of July 14, 2025 to July 20, 2025.

Donkey Kong Bananza for Switch 2 was the highest selling new game release of the week, opening at 127,905 retail copies sold. Mario Kart World for Switch 2 was still the highest selling overall title last week, however, moving  an additional 135,370 units.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 152,165 units, the Switch family sold 11,766 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 6,148 units, the Xbox Series family sold 150 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 22 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 135,370 (1,495,609)
  2. [SW2] Donkey Kong Bananza (Nintendo, 07/17/25) – 127,905 (New)
  3. [NSW] Tamagotchi Plaza (Bandai Namco, 06/26/25) – 9,081 (149,279)
  4. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) – 8,152 (6,381,356)
  5. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 6,664 (8,172,980)
  6. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) – 5,885 (1,349,665)
  7. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) – 5,385 (3,939,274)
